arts.ttl: Abdul Fatawu screamer sets up Leicester’s impressive win over Birmingham
arts.sum: Abdul Fatawu’s stunning early goal and Ricardo Pereira’s late effort gave Leicester a hard-fought but deserved victory over Birmingham in the Championship. Fatawu’s brilliant finish lit up a game of precious few chances, as these two Midlands rivals slugged it out under the lights at the KP Stadium. Chris Davies’s side, who came into the contest unbeaten in the second tier, improved as the match between two of the league’s most fancied clubs wore on. But with Jay Stansfield ruled out they struggled to create enough to trouble Martí Cifuentes’s side, before the Leicester substitute pounced following 16-year-old Jeremy Monga’s memorable assist. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Leicester City 2-0 Birmingham City: Foxes take all three points with impressive performance
arts.sum: Leicester started this match on the front foot from the first whistle and got their reward in the 9th minute via Abdul Fatawu, who made it two from two following his goal at Charlton last weekend. Birmingham were beginning to grow into the game with 15 minutes left before half-time as they began to put more pressure on Leicester's box and looked much more threatening than they had done in the early stages.

arts.ttl: Fatawu strikes again as Leicester end Birmingham's unbeaten start
arts.sum: Leicester City ended Birmingham's unbeaten start to the Championship season with a 2-0 victory at the King Power Stadium.
